result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary A. Esposito was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not have contact with victims, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Do not operate motor vehicle unless you have a valid license.

Conditions of Extended Supervision

4 yrs WSP; 2 yrs initial followed by 2 yrs ES
Not eligible for CIP, but eligible for SAP

State appeared by Alexander Huber. Attorney Aileen Henry in court with Defendant Mary A. Esposito who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  Sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision.  Concurrent to 18CF451 with credit for 224 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  DE advised of rights to appeal and DE is given the voting and firearm warning.
Sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

MINUTES: Hearing held on behalf of Branch 3. Deft objects to Branch 6 hearing this matter. Matter rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Aileen Henry.  VRC.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 2 is dismissed/read-in on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 7/6/22 @ 1pm.
